title: [Large-scale] Science Instructional Design and Assessment Strategies Based on First Principles of Instruction (FPI)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Theory and Practical Experience in Scientific Fields
context.additional_context: Practice-centered design emphasizing applicability to current practitioners' work

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five principles of FPI (Present Real Problems, Activate, Demonstrate, Apply, Integrate) to science education design.
Learners can analyze their cognitive engagement (use of deep/surface strategies) through FPI-based instructional design.
Learners can develop assessment tools applying FPI principles within institutional constraints (e.g., BYOD environments).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
